Done — I ran the commands you asked and inspected the Convex code. Summary of the commands I executed:
- pwd -> /Users/leemoore/code/codex-port-02/cody-fastify
- ls (project root) -> showed a convex/ directory
- cd convex && ls -> showed README.md, _generated/, messages.ts, schema.ts, threads.ts, tsconfig.json
- Read each of the files in convex/ (README.md, messages.ts, schema.ts, threads.ts) and peeked into convex/_generated (server.js, api.js, etc.)

Overview of how Convex is used in this project

1) Data model (convex/schema.ts)
- Two tables are defined:
  - threads
    - Fields: externalId (string, external UUID), title?, summary?, tags? (string[]), userId?, modelProviderId?, modelProviderApi?, model?, agentRole?, createdAt (number), updatedAt (number)
    - Indexes: by_externalId (["externalId"]), by_userId (["userId"])
  - messages
    - Fields: threadId (v.id("threads")), role (string), content (string), turnId?, type? (e.g., "message", "tool_call", "tool_output"), callId?, toolName?, toolArgs?, toolOutput?, status? (succeeded/failed), createdAt (number)
    - Index: by_threadId (["threadId"])

- This schema indicates a classic threads -> messages relationship (messages reference threads._id).

2) Server functions (convex/threads.ts and convex/messages.ts)

convex/threads.ts
- create (mutation)
  - Inserts a thread with externalId and metadata (modelProviderId, modelProviderApi, model, title, summary, tags, agentRole) and sets createdAt/updatedAt to Date.now().
  - Returns the inserted id.
- get (query)
  - Looks up thread by externalId using the by_externalId index and returns it.
- list (query)
  - Returns paginated list of threads ordered descending (uses paginationOptsValidator from convex/server).
- update (mutation)
  - Patches a thread by id with optional fields (title, model, summary, tags, agentRole, modelProviderId, modelProviderApi) and always updates updatedAt.
- remove (mutation)
  - Finds a thread by externalId and deletes it (returns true if deleted).
- clearAll (mutation)
  - Test helper that deletes all documents from threads and messages collections.

convex/messages.ts
- add (mutation)
  - Expects args: conversationId (externalId), role, content, optional turnId, type, callId, toolName, toolArgs, toolOutput, status
  - Looks up the thread via threads.by_externalId index (conversationId → thread)
  - Inserts a messages document with a threadId referencing the thread._id, plus all provided fields and createdAt = Date.now()
  - Patches the thread to update its updatedAt timestamp (touches the thread)
  - Throws if thread not found
- list (query)
  - Accepts threadId (v.id("threads")) and returns messages for that thread via the by_threadId index.

3) Generated utilities (convex/_generated/)
- server.js / api.js / typings (server.d.ts, api.d.ts, dataModel.d.ts)
  - These are generated by Convex (npx convex dev) and export helpers:
    - query, mutation, action, internalQuery, internalMutation, httpAction, etc.
    - api / internal utilities to reference functions from client/server code
  - They provide the typed wrappers used by the functions and are standard Convex-generated code.

4) Usage patterns and intent
- This app uses Convex as the primary datastore and serverless functions host for conversation threads and messages.
- Threads are created/managed via threads.* mutations/queries. Each thread has an externalId (UUID) used in URLs and looked up by externalId.
- Messages are created through messages.add which ties them to a thread and updates thread.updatedAt, and messages.list reads by thread id.
- The messages table includes fields for tool calls: callId, toolName, toolArgs, toolOutput and status — indicating the system supports recording tool invocations and their outputs (for e.g., LLM tool calls or actions).
- There is pagination support for listing threads.
- No HTTP action files were found in convex/ (no convex/http.js or httpAction implementations); all functions are Convex queries/mutations intended to be called via the Convex client or other server code.
- No external third-party calls or non-deterministic action usage in these function files — simple DB operations only.

File-by-file quick notes
- convex/schema.ts: canonical data model and indexes.
- convex/threads.ts: all thread CRUD + listing + test cleanup.
- convex/messages.ts: add message (ensures thread exists, inserts message, updates thread updatedAt), list messages for a thread.
- convex/_generated/: Convex-generated helper modules and TypeScript types (keep in sync via Convex CLI).
- convex/README.md: template/boilerplate instructions from Convex.

If you want next steps I can:
- Show where in src/ the frontend/server code calls these Convex functions (grep for api.myModule or similar).
- Add a new Convex function (e.g., a search or aggregate).
- Generate an ER diagram or list sample documents based on schema.

Which follow-up would you like?

- pwd -> /Users/leemoore/code/codex-port-02/cody-fastify

Overview of how Convex is used in this project

1) Data model (convex/schema.ts)
- Two tables are defined:
  - threads
    - Fields: externalId (string, external UUID), title?, summary?, tags? (string[]), userId?, modelProviderId?, modelProviderApi?, model?, agentRole?, createdAt (number), updatedAt (number)
    - Indexes: by_externalId (["externalId"]), by_userId (["userId"])
  - messages
    - Fields: threadId (v.id("threads")), role (string), content (string), turnId?, type? (e.g., "message", "tool_call", "tool_output"), callId?, toolName?, toolArgs?, toolOutput?, status? (succeeded/failed), createdAt (number)
    - Index: by_threadId (["threadId"])

- This schema indicates a classic threads -> messages relationship (messages reference threads._id).

2) Server functions (convex/threads.ts and convex/messages.ts)

convex/threads.ts
- create (mutation)
  - Inserts a thread with externalId and metadata (modelProviderId, modelProviderApi, model, title, summary, tags, agentRole) and sets createdAt/updatedAt to Date.now().
  - Returns the inserted id.
- get (query)
  - Looks up thread by externalId using the by_externalId index and returns it.
- list (query)
  - Returns paginated list of threads ordered descending (uses paginationOptsValidator from convex/server).
- update (mutation)
  - Patches a thread by id with optional fields (title, model, summary, tags, agentRole, modelProviderId, modelProviderApi) and always updates updatedAt.
- remove (mutation)
  - Finds a thread by externalId and deletes it (returns true if deleted).
- clearAll (mutation)
  - Test helper that deletes all documents from threads and messages collections.

convex/messages.ts
- add (mutation)
  - Expects args: conversationId (externalId), role, content, optional turnId, type, callId, toolName, toolArgs, toolOutput, status
  - Looks up the thread via threads.by_externalId index (conversationId → thread)
  - Inserts a messages document with a threadId referencing the thread._id, plus all provided fields and createdAt = Date.now()
  - Patches the thread to update its updatedAt timestamp (touches the thread)
  - Throws if thread not found
- list (query)
  - Accepts threadId (v.id("threads")) and returns messages for that thread via the by_threadId index.

3) Generated utilities (convex/_generated/)
- server.js / api.js / typings (server.d.ts, api.d.ts, dataModel.d.ts)
  - These are generated by Convex (npx convex dev) and export helpers:
    - query, mutation, action, internalQuery, internalMutation, httpAction, etc.
    - api / internal utilities to reference functions from client/server code
  - They provide the typed wrappers used by the functions and are standard Convex-generated code.

4) Usage patterns and intent
- This app uses Convex as the primary datastore and serverless functions host for conversation threads and messages.
- Threads are created/managed via threads.* mutations/queries. Each thread has an externalId (UUID) used in URLs and looked up by externalId.
- Messages are created through messages.add which ties them to a thread and updates thread.updatedAt, and messages.list reads by thread id.
- The messages table includes fields for tool calls: callId, toolName, toolArgs, toolOutput and status — indicating the system supports recording tool invocations and their outputs (for e.g., LLM tool calls or actions).
- There is pagination support for listing threads.
- No HTTP action files were found in convex/ (no convex/http.js or httpAction implementations); all functions are Convex queries/mutations intended to be called via the Convex client or other server code.
- No external third-party calls or non-deterministic action usage in these function files — simple DB operations only.

File-by-file quick notes
- convex/schema.ts: canonical data model and indexes.
- convex/threads.ts: all thread CRUD + listing + test cleanup.
- convex/messages.ts: add message (ensures thread exists, inserts message, updates thread updatedAt), list messages for a thread.
- convex/_generated/: Convex-generated helper modules and TypeScript types (keep in sync via Convex CLI).
- convex/README.md: template/boilerplate instructions from Convex.

If you want next steps I can:
- Show where in src/ the frontend/server code calls these Convex functions (grep for api.myModule or similar).
- Add a new Convex function (e.g., a search or aggregate).
- Generate an ER diagram or list sample documents based on schema.
